alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 2:02PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, Riverside. * WHEN...Until 500 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 201 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Periods of thunderstorms are expected through the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Palm Springs, Mt San Jacinto State Park, Hwy 243 Between Banning And Idyllwild, western Desert Hot Springs, Whitewater, Cabazon and Morongo Indian Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
